properties.areaDesc: Grand Forks; Norman; West Polk; Griggs; Steele; Traill; Nelson
properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 11 at 7:01PM CST until February 12 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Grand Forks ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Blizzard
Warning, blizzard conditions expected in open country. Total
snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as
45 mph.

* WHERE...Portions of northwest Minnesota and northeast and
southeast North Dakota.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 9 AM to 3 PM CST
Wednesday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM CST
Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility in open country. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty
winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind
chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10
minutes.
properties.instruction:
Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you
wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at
dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling
5 1 1 in either state.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 3 PM CST WEDNESDAY
